tooltips.companyInfo: Configure your company information including name, address, contact details, and tax number. This information will appear on invoices and reports.
tooltips.systemConfig: System-wide configuration including language, timezone, number formats, and fiscal year settings.
tooltips.invoiceSettings: Configure numbering systems for invoices, quotes, and purchase orders. Set prefixes and next numbers for automatic generation.
tooltips.emailSettings: Configure email notifications and SMTP settings for sending automated emails, invoices, and system notifications.

form.openingBalanceTooltip: Opening balance is the initial balance when creating the account. It can only be edited if there are no transactions yet.
form.headerAccountTooltip: Header accounts are used to group other accounts. They cannot have transactions or opening balance.
form.creatingHeaderDesc: Header accounts are used to group other accounts in a hierarchy. They cannot have transactions or opening balance.
form.openingBalanceLocked: Opening balance is locked after account creation
form.openingBalanceLockedDesc: Opening balance cannot be changed after account creation. Use journal entries to adjust balance.
form.adminOverrideDesc: You can edit opening balance as an admin. Use this feature carefully as it may affect financial reports.
form.headerRestrictionDesc: Header accounts cannot have opening balance. The opening balance has been set to zero.
form.categoryTooltip: Categories help organize accounts for financial reporting. They are automatically assigned based on the account type and parent account to ensure consistency.

validation.invalidCodeFormat: Invalid account code format. Use XXXX or XXXX-XXX (e.g., 1101 or 1101-004)
validation.childCodePrefix: Child code must start with parent code:

guide.title: Chart of Accounts (COA) Guide
guide.tip1: Do not delete accounts that have transactions
guide.tip2: Header Account (parent) cannot be deleted if it has children
guide.tip4: Backup data before deleting important accounts
guide.hardcodedWarning: IMPORTANT: Some accounts are hardcoded in the backend and must exist for the system to work!
guide.recreate4: Make sure parent account exists (e.g., 1100 - CURRENT ASSETS)
guide.recreate5: Do not check "Is Header" (except for large categories)
guide.proTip: Pro Tip: Use "Add Header Account" button to create large categories, then "Add Account" for detailed accounts within them.
guide.headerTooltip: Create large categories (Header) like ASSETS, CURRENT ASSETS, LIABILITIES, etc. Headers cannot be used for direct transactions, only for grouping accounts.
guide.accountTooltip: Create detailed accounts like CASH (1101), BANK (1102), ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE (1201) that can be used to record transactions. REQUIRED: CASH, BANK, VAT INPUT (1240), VAT OUTPUT (2103) are hardcoded in backend!
guide.warningDesc: The following accounts MUST EXIST and are hardcoded in backend: CASH (1101), BANK (1102), VAT INPUT (1240), VAT OUTPUT (2103), SALES REVENUE (4101), COST OF GOODS SOLD (5101). If deleted, MUST be recreated with the EXACT same code, UPPERCASE name, and type! Click the ðŸ“š icon for complete guide.

messages.noPermissionCreate: You do not have permission to create sales. Contact your administrator for access.
messages.noPermissionEdit: You do not have permission to edit sales. Contact your administrator for access.
messages.pleaseLogin: Please login to access this feature.
messages.failedToLoadData: Failed to load form data. Please try again.
messages.atLeastOneItem: At least one item with a selected product is required
messages.atLeastOneItemManual: At least one item with description and price is required
messages.dueDateBeforeInvoice: Due Date cannot be earlier than invoice date
messages.dateFormatInfo: Dates are displayed in Indonesian format with month name (DD Month YYYY)

description.profitLoss: Comprehensive profit and loss statement with enhanced analysis. Automatically integrates journal entry data for accurate revenue, COGS, and expense reporting with detailed financial metrics.
description.balanceSheet: Provides a company's assets, liabilities, and shareholders' equity at a specific point in time.
description.cashFlow: Measures how well a company generates cash to pay its debt obligations and fund its operating expenditures.
description.salesSummary: Provides a summary of sales transactions over a period.
description.purchaseReport: Comprehensive purchase analysis with credible vendor transactions, payment history, and performance metrics. Real-time data from SSOT journal integration.
description.vendorAnalysis: Comprehensive analysis of vendor transactions, payment history, and performance metrics.
description.trialBalance: Summary of all account balances to ensure debits equal credits and verify accounting equation.
description.generalLedger: Complete record of all financial transactions organized by account for detailed analysis.
description.customerHistory: Complete record of customer activities including sales transactions and payment history. Filter by customer name to view detailed transaction timeline.
description.vendorHistory: Complete record of vendor activities including purchase transactions and payment history. Filter by vendor name to view detailed transaction timeline.

modal.noPLDataMessage: No P&L relevant transactions found for this period. The journal entries contain mainly asset purchases, payments, and deposits which affect the Balance Sheet rather than P&L.
modal.noPLDataHint: To generate meaningful P&L data, record sales transactions, operating expenses, and cost of goods sold.
modal.realTimeIntegration: Real-time integration with SSOT Journal System
modal.selectFromClosedPeriods: Select from previously closed periods or enter custom date
modal.fetchingRealTimeData: Fetching real-time data from SSOT journal system...
modal.netIncomeTooltip: Net Income from Profit & Loss Statement. If Rp 0, this period may have been closed and profit/loss has been transferred to Retained Earnings.
modal.adjustmentsTooltip: Adjustments include non-cash items such as depreciation, amortization, and changes in retained earnings. After closing, changed retained earnings will appear here.
modal.workingCapitalTooltip: Working capital changes include changes in receivables, payables, inventory, and other current accounts that affect cash.
modal.totalOperatingCashFlowTooltip: Total cash generated from the company's operating activities. This shows the company's ability to generate cash from its core business.
modal.completeRecordCustomer: Complete record of customer activities and payment history
modal.selectDateRange: Select a customer and date range to view their transaction history

integrationGuide.title: Integration Guide
integrationGuide.description: All reports are integrated with SSOT (Single Source of Truth) data system. Reports automatically use your company settings (logo, name, address, etc.) from the Settings page and provide real-time data with advanced export capabilities (CSV, PDF).

profitLoss.title: Profit and Loss Statement
profitLoss.analysisNotAvailable: Financial analysis not available for this report format

tooltips.grossProfit: ðŸ“ˆ GROSS PROFIT: Revenue minus COGS. This margin shows production/purchasing efficiency. The higher, the better!
tooltips.operatingIncome: ðŸ’¼ OPERATING INCOME: Gross profit minus operating expenses. Shows profitability from core business activities before interest and taxes.
tooltips.ebitda: ðŸ“Š EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation & Amortization): Operating profit before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization. Shows business cash-generating ability.
tooltips.netIncome: âœ¨ NET INCOME: Final profit (bottom line) after all costs, taxes, interest. This shows true profitability and how much can be retained/distributed to owners.
tooltips.revenue: ðŸ’° REVENUE: Total money received from selling goods/services to customers. This is the main source of company income before deducting costs.
tooltips.cogs: ðŸ“¦ COST OF GOODS SOLD (COGS): Direct costs to produce or purchase goods sold. Includes raw materials, direct labor, and production overhead.
tooltips.operatingExpenses: ðŸ¢ OPERATING EXPENSES: Costs to run daily business like employee salaries, office rent, electricity, marketing, administration. Does not include COGS.
tooltips.otherIncome: ðŸŽ OTHER INCOME: Income outside main business, such as deposit interest, asset sale gains, or rental income.
tooltips.otherExpenses: ðŸ“‰ OTHER EXPENSES: Costs outside normal operations, such as loan interest, asset sale losses, or penalties.

insights.profitabilityPositive: The company is generating positive returns
insights.ebitdaMarginIndicates: EBITDA margin of {{margin}}% indicates {{strength}} cash generation ability

page.title: Enhanced Profit & Loss Report
page.description: Generate comprehensive P&L statements with journal entry drilldown capabilities
page.featureEnhanced: Journal entry-based calculations for accurate financial metrics
page.featureInteractive: Click any line item to drill down to supporting journal entries
page.featureComprehensive: Includes gross profit, operating income, EBITDA, and net income with margins
page.featureExportReady: Export to PDF or CSV with detailed formatting
page.featureRealTime: Enable auto-refresh when account balances change via WebSocket
page.featureLiveData: Get instant notifications when underlying journal entries are updated
page.missingParametersDesc: Please provide start date and end date
page.generationFailedDesc: Failed to generate enhanced P&L report

cogsWarning.title: COGS Data Missing
cogsWarning.description: Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) entries are missing
cogsWarning.cogsExplanation: COGS (Cost of Goods Sold) represents the direct costs of producing goods sold by a company. Without COGS entries, your P&L report will show incorrect Net Profit.
cogsWarning.autoCreateDesc: This will automatically create COGS journal entries for all sales without them.
cogsWarning.continueAnywayDesc: Generate P&L without COGS. The report will show Expenses = 0 and incorrect Net Profit.
cogsWarning.backfillCompleteDesc: Successfully processed {{count}} sales transactions. COGS entries have been created.

cashFlow.title: Cash Flow Statement
cashFlow.analyzingJournalEntries: Analyzing journal entries for cash flow activities...

tooltips.periodClosedHistory: Select a closed period to view historical Cash Flow report
tooltips.netIncome: Net Income from Profit & Loss Statement. If Rp 0, this period may be closed and profit/loss has been transferred to Retained Earnings.
tooltips.adjustments: Adjustments include non-cash items such as depreciation, amortization, and changes in retained earnings. After period closing, changes in retained earnings will appear here.
tooltips.workingCapitalChanges: Working capital changes include changes in receivables, payables, inventory, and other current accounts that affect cash.
tooltips.totalOperatingCashFlow: Total cash generated from the company's operating activities. This shows the company's ability to generate cash from its core business.

formula.operatingCashFlow: = Net Income + Adjustments + Working Capital Changes

cashBank.title: Cash & Bank Management
cashBank.integrationDesc: All cash and bank accounts are automatically integrated with your Chart of Accounts (COA) for proper financial reporting and audit compliance.
cashBank.linksToBalanceSheet: Links to Balance Sheet: Current Assets
cashBank.noBankAccountsFound: No bank accounts found. Click "Add Bank Account" to create one.
cashBank.noCashAccountsFound: No cash accounts found. Click "Add Cash Account" to create one.
cashBank.fullAuditTrailShort: Full audit trail via journal entries
cashBank.accountMustHaveZeroBalance: Account must have zero balance before deletion
cashBank.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete account
cashBank.errorFixingGLLinks: An error occurred while fixing GL account links
cashBank.successfullyIntegrated: Successfully integrated with Chart of Accounts
cashBank.linkAccountToCOA: Link this account to your Chart of Accounts.

form.accountTypeCannotChange: Account type cannot be changed after creation
form.accountNameMinLength: Account name must be at least 2 characters
form.currencyAutoSet: Currency is automatically set to Indonesian Rupiah
form.bankNameRequired: Bank name is required for bank accounts
form.accountNumberOptional: Optional: Bank account number for reference
form.openingBalanceHelp: Initial balance when creating this account
form.openingDateNotFuture: Opening date cannot be in the future
form.coaIntegrationDesc: Configure how this account links to your Chart of Accounts
form.coaIntegrationInfo: Each cash/bank account must be linked to a GL account in your Chart of Accounts. This ensures proper financial reporting and audit trails.
form.manualCOADesc: You must create a GL Account in the Chart of Accounts first before integrating it here. Visit the Chart of Accounts page to create a new Asset account (Current Asset category, 1100-series code recommended).
form.manualCOAExample: Example: If you want to create a new bank account "Bank BCA", first create a GL account with code "1102-001" and name "Bank BCA" in the Chart of Accounts page, then select it here.
form.selectGLAccount: Select Existing GL Account (Asset Type Only)
form.selectGLAccountPlaceholder: Choose GL account from Chart of Accounts...
form.glAccountHelp: Only active Asset accounts (Current Asset category) are shown. If no accounts are available, please create one in the Chart of Accounts page first.
form.noCashGLAvailable: No cash GL accounts available. All cash GL accounts are already in use or haven't been created yet.
form.noBankGLAvailable: No bank GL accounts available. All bank GL accounts are already in use or haven't been created yet.
form.cashGLHelp: Only showing GL accounts with "KAS" in the name that are not already linked
form.bankGLHelp: Only showing GL accounts with "BANK" in the name that are not already linked
form.coaBenefit1: Automatic journal entries for all transactions
form.coaBenefit2: Proper balance sheet and income statement reporting
form.coaBenefit3: Full audit trail and compliance readiness
form.coaBenefit4: Real-time synchronization between cash/bank and GL
form.errorBankName: Bank name is required for bank accounts
form.errorGLAccount: Please select a GL account from Chart of Accounts. You must create the COA account manually first.

assets.title: Asset Management
assets.noAssets: No assets found. Click 'Add Asset' to create your first asset.

form.manualAssetEntryDesc: This form is for recording existing assets only (no financial transactions). For new asset purchases, use the Purchases module to create purchase orders.
form.salvageValueTooltip: Estimated value of the asset at the end of its useful life.
form.salvageValueExample: Example: A car worth Rp 100 million, after 5 years still worth Rp 20 million = salvage value Rp 20 million.
form.depreciationMethodTooltip: Straight Line: same depreciation cost each period. Declining Balance: higher cost at the beginning, decreasing over time.
form.fixedAssetAccountNote: This account will be debited (default: 1500 - Fixed Assets)
form.depreciationAccountNote: For monthly depreciation entries (default: 6201 - Depreciation Expense)
form.enterPhysicalLocation: Enter asset physical location (e.g., Office Building Floor 2, Room 201)

form.gpsNote: Pinpoint exact location on map for better asset tracking
form.saveAssetFirst: Save Asset First to Upload Image
